ai.summary: A very short, easy hike along Carn Brea FP 12 in the UK, covering about 0.8 km. Suitable for families and beginners, with a well-marked path and gentle terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows a well-marked footpath with a firm surface for most of the way, plus occasional gentle undulations and small steps. Ground can be uneven in places and may be muddy after rain. The route can be exposed to wind at higher points.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and daylight before starting. Wear sturdy footwear and bring layers and a rain jacket. Stay on the marked path, watch for loose stones, and be mindful of any livestock or other hikers. Carry water, a map or charged phone with offline maps, and a small first aid kit. Have a plan in case of emergency and supervise children or pets at all times.
recommended_gear: Sturdy, comfortable walking shoes or boots
Map, compass or a charged phone with offline maps
ai.best_seasons: Year-round; best in spring to autumn.

seo.title: Carn Brea FP 12 – 0.8 km Easy Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a short, easy 0.8 km hike on Carn Brea FP 12 in the UK. Terrain overview, safety tips, and gear for this quick countryside stroll.
